Name: Statue of a Man Holding a Naos
Description: This statue portrays a man standing with his left leg forward, holding a small shrine known as a naos. He is wearing a small kilt with a belt. The figure of a god, Khonsu or Thoth, is represented inside the shrine. Hieroglyphic inscriptions cover a column that supports the back of the statue. The nose, mouth, ears, legs, and left arm are all broken.
